resources.string: Scan any QR Code / Barcode\nto get started.
Connects with the last device on start
Use the front camera instead of the back facing if supported by the device
Shows a overlay on the scanner
Specify the shape of the overlay
Codes need to be fully in the area
Interval in which the image is analyzed. Higher frequencies will lead to a higher CPU usage.
Resolution of the analyzed image. Higher resolutions take longer to analyze.
Specify which key should be appended to the end of each text sent to the PC
Play sound when scanning a code
Uses the raw value from the code
Time between each character/digit when sending a text
This app requires Bluetooth permissions to communicate with other devices. Please allow the app access to \'Nearby Devices\'.
Camera is required for showing the preview and in order to scan codes. Please allow the app permission to \'Camera\'.
Location permission is required for scanning new devices.
Location needs to be enabled on your device.
If you are unable to connect, unpair the device on both sides then try connecting to it again from within the app.
Vibrates when scanning a new code
Only enable desired types to improve scanning speed. Select none to enable all.
Enable only specific types to improve scanning speed
Unable to get BT-Proxy! Try restarting the app…
Set the keyboard layout. Change if you want to type special characters or don\'t use a QWERTY layout.
Failed to download and install the ML-Kit Barcode module.
Ensure that you have an active internet connection and that the Google Play Services are installed on your device.
Otherwise you can download the bundled APK version from the GitHub page which already contains the module.

Requesting download and installation of the ML-Kit Barcode module through Google Play.\n\nThis only has to be done once. Usually when installing the app as APK or clearing the Google Play Services data.
Unpairing will remove the device from your paired devices list.
Are you sure you want to reset to default?
View the source code on GitHub
If you like this app, please rate it on Google Play
Share the app with your friends
Please enable Bluetooth in the system settings or by clicking the button below.
Select how detected codes are highlighted
Disable if you only want to focus by tapping the screen
Enables the screen to rotate when the device orientation changes
Helps to reduce motion blur in the image
Allows to filter codes by a regular expression
Supports common regex syntax. Use empty string or .* to match everything. If the regex contains a capture group "(…)", the value of the group will be used.
Allows you to set a custom template

Make sure to set 'Extra keys' to 'Custom'.

 CODE placeholders:
 • {CODE} - plain barcode
 • Encoding: _HEX, _B64 can be combined in any order
 • Examples: {CODE_HEX}, {CODE_B64}, {CODE_HEX_B64}, {HEX_B64_CODE}

 Date/Time placeholders with optional formatting:
 • {DATE} - current date (default: yyyy-MM-dd)
 • {TIME} - current time (default: HH:mm:ss)
 • {DATETIME} - date and time (default: yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss)
 • {SCAN_TIME} - scan timestamp (default: yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.SSS)
 • Custom format: {DATE[format]}, {TIME[format]}, {DATETIME[format]}, {SCAN_TIME[format]}

 Format patterns:
 • EEEE - day of week (full name), EEE - day of week (short)
 • MMMM - month (full name), MMM - month (short), MM - month (numeric)
 • yyyy - year (full), yy - year (last two digits), dd - day
 • HH - hour (24h), hh - hour (12h), mm - minute, ss - second, SSS - milliseconds, a - AM/PM
 • Note: Text in quotes ('text') will be displayed literally

 Format examples:
 • {DATE[dd.MM.yyyy]} → 03.10.2025
 • {TIME[HH:mm:ss]} → 14:30:45
 • {DATETIME[EEEE, MMMM dd yyyy]} → Friday, October 03 2025
 • {DATETIME[dd.MM.yyyy HH:mm]} → 03.10.2025 14:30
 • {SCAN_TIME[dd/MM/yy HH:mm]} → 03/10/25 14:30

 Metadata placeholders:
 • {CODE_TYPE} - barcode type (QR_CODE, CODE_128, etc.)
 • {SCAN_SOURCE} - data source (SCAN, HISTORY, MANUAL)
 • {SCANNER_ID} - scanner hardware identifier

 Universal encoding (works with ANY data placeholder):
 • Add _HEX or _B64 to any placeholder in any order
 • Examples: {DATE_HEX}, {TIME_B64}, {CODE_TYPE_HEX}, {DATETIME[dd.MM.yyyy]_B64}
 • Combination: {DATE[dd.MM.yyyy]_HEX_B64}, {CODE_TYPE_B64_HEX}

 Global encoding (applied to entire output):
 • {GLOBAL_HEX} - encode entire result to hexadecimal
 • {GLOBAL_B64} - encode entire result to base64
 • Combinations: {GLOBAL_HEX_B64}, {GLOBAL_B64_HEX}

 Other placeholders:
 • Keys: {F1–24}, {ENTER}, {ESC}, {TAB}, {BKSP}, {LEFT}, {RIGHT}, {UP}, {DOWN}
 • Special: {SPACE}, {CR}, {LF}, {WAIT:n}

 Modifiers (prepend to placeholder):
 • ^: Shift, +: Ctrl, #: Alt, @: Meta
 • Examples: {+r} = CTRL+R, {^#F1} = SHIFT+ALT+F1, {WAIT:10} = 10 char delay
Select your preferred focus behaviour. Some modes disable the ability to focus manually by tapping the screen.
Are you sure you want to clear the history?
Scanner will be shown in full screen
Zooms in on codes that are to far away
Click here to turn it off
Prevents screen from turning off while scanning
Hides the scan value by default
Error initializing camera. Please restart the app or your device. If this keeps happening, please create a new issue on Github.
Modify the scanned value using JS
Allows you to enter any JavaScript to modify the value of the code. Two constants are defined (\'format\' and \'code\'). Last statement is used as result (no return required).
Are you sure you want to delete the selected item(s)?
Expand templates in the code value (Requires custom template)
Error connecting to device! Trying to restart service…
Enter the character and the corresponding HID-code (not scancode) including any modifiers. The HID-code of the ENTER key is for example 28 (hex).
* To test the key out you need to be connected with a device.
Allows you to define custom character to HID-code mappings, that will override any definitions from the selected keyboard layout.
Template must contain at least one CODE component.
XML and JSON are mutually exclusive.
Use volume up/down to send the barcode

The OCR extension requires an external app to provide the detection functionality. If you want to use this feature, the following app needs to be installed separately on your device.\nYou can choose between the ML-Kit or Tesseract based version of the app.\n(Note that this is a third-party app over which I don\'t have any control)
After this, you can use the new button in the bottom right corner of the scanner to trigger the detection.
Select all lines that should be sent.
Clears shown code after sending it manually
HID emulates keyboard input, RFCOMM sends data via Bluetooth COM port (may require additional software)
This option enables insecure RFCOMM connections. Only use for legacy devices that don\'t support secure connections using Bluetooth Serial Port Profile.
Keep HID-specific placeholders (e.g., {F1}, {ESC}) as text instead of removing them in RFCOMM mode
